title: Trump says acting Homeland Security chief McAleenan will step down
text:
President Trump Donald John TrumpDemocratic 2020 hopefuls tout LGBTQ plans at town hall Trump defends Syria move at rally: 'Bring our troops back home' Pompeo adviser resigning: report MORE announced Friday night that Acting Homeland Security Secretary Kevin McAleenan would step down from his position.

“Kevin McAleenan has done an outstanding job as Acting Secretary of Homeland Security. We have worked well together with Border Crossings being way down," tweeted Trump, who tapped McAleenan to lead the department earlier this year.

ADVERTISEMENT

"Kevin now, after many years in Government, wants to spend more time with his family and go to the private sector,” Trump tweeted. “Congratulations Kevin, on a job well done!”

Trump said that he will announce McAleenan’s successor next week, adding: “Many wonderful candidates!”

....Congratulations Kevin, on a job well done! I will be announcing the new Acting Secretary next week. Many wonderful candidates! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 11, 2019

Trump named McAleenan the department’s acting chief in April after Kirstjen Nielsen Kirstjen Michele NielsenActivists to demonstrate at ICE headquarters after Cameroonian immigrant dies in custody Ex-Citizenship and Immigration Services chief returns to DHS in different role Trump suggested shooting migrants in the legs: NYT MORE's resignation. McAleenan was never nominated for the position full-time, and his eventual successor will require Senate confirmation.
description: President Trump announced Friday night that Acting Homeland Security Secretary Kevin McAleenan would step down from his position.
